## Real People Behind the Characters

### Atticus Finch
Amasa Coleman Lee, Lee's father, was an attorney similar to Atticus Finch. In 1919, he defended two black men accused of murder. After they were convicted, hanged and mutilated, he never took another criminal case.(no content)It is widely believed that Harper Lee based the character of Atticus Finch on her father, Amasa Coleman Lee, a compassionate and dedicated lawyer.(no content)The character was largely based on Lee's own father, lawyer A.C. Lee.(no content)Lee's father was also the editor and publisher of the Monroeville newspaper.

### Scout Finch
Several people and events from Lee's childhood parallel those of the fictional Scout.(no content)Other key characters, including Scout, her brother Jem, and their mysterious neighbor Boo Radley, were inspired by Lee's childhood in Monroeville, Alabama. The character of Scout appears to be based on Harper Lee herself as a child growing up in Monroeville.

### Dill Harris
Dill Harris is believed to be based on a childhood friend of Harper Lee, the author Truman Capote. This is particularly interesting as Truman Capote was indeed Lee's childhood friend and neighbor in Monroeville.

### The Finch Family Name
Their family name Finch is also Lee's mother's maiden name.
